titles.title: Anti-Collusion Act

To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to treat the sharing of nonpublic campaign material by a candidate or political committee with a foreign power as the solicitation of a contribution or donation in support of the candidate or committee from a foreign national for purposes of the ban on such solicitations under such Act, and for other purposes.
Anti-Collusion Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

term.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption

bill.summary:
Anti-Collusion Act
This bill expands the ban on solicitations of campaign contributions or donations by foreign nationals to include providing nonpublic campaign information, including polling data and opposition research. Specifically, the ban shall apply if a candidate, a political committee, or an affiliate offers or provides nonpublic campaign material to a foreign power.
Upon receipt of an offer of assistance by a foreign power, a candidate, committee, or individual must report the offer to the Department of Justice within 72 hours.
